title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.49 - Rates and charges effective upon adoption of the rule
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.49 - Rates and charges effective upon adoption of the rule

State Regulations
(a) Landing fee. $0.50 per 1,000 pounds of
aircraft certified maximum takeoff weight for the first 12,500 pounds. $1 for
each 1,000 pounds above 12,500 pounds up to 70,000 pounds. Then $2 for each
1,000 pounds above 70,000 pounds. The minimum landing fee is $2.50. (b) Terminal use fee. Either (by choice of
the carrier): (1)
$150 per aircraft operation
with an arrival and departure constituting separate operations. (2)
$2 per seat based on the total seats in
the aircraft. (c) Non-leased ticket counter use fee. $25 per use. (d) Aircraft ramp parking fee. After
direction by airport operator to remove the aircraft, $25 for the first two
hours and $10 per hour thereafter. (e) Tie-down fees. $125 per month for single
engine aircraft and $150 per month for multi-engine aircraft. Beginning April
1, 2008, $140 per month for single engine aircraft and $170 per month for
multi-engine aircraft. (f) Fuel
flowage fee. $.07 per gallon for each gallon of jet fuel sold at the airport
and $.05 per gallon for each gallon of aviation fuel sold at the
airport. (g) Aircraft overnight
ramp parking fee. $180 per month. (h) Airship mooring fee. $150 per
day. (i) Land use fees. $200 per
acre per day. (j) Film/commercial
usage fee. $1,650 per day for taxiways
$750 per hour for runways
$1,450 per day for the terminal building
$1,600 per day for the ramp
$1,200 per day for non-operational areas
(k) Aircraft removal from runway or taxiway
fee. $375 for single engine aircraft and $750 for multi-engine
aircraft. (l) Meeting room usage
fee. $200 per day. $60 per day for non-profit or public
organizations. (m) Commercial
operating permit fee. $200 per year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
78.49

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
